title: Hint
text:
$$1$$. Identify the inequalities: We have two inequalities that must both be true simultaneously:
• $$x$$ < $$3$$
• $$x$$ $$ \geq $$ $$1$$

$$2$$. Combine the inequalities: Since both must be satisfied at the same time, we express this as:
$$1$$ $$ \leq $$ $$x$$ < $$3$$

$$3$$. Interpret in interval notation: The smallest $$x$$ can be is $$1$$, and it can reach $$1$$ (because of $$“ \geq ”)$$, but it must be strictly less than $$3$$ (because of “< 3”), so the interval is:
[1, 3)

Answer (in interval notation): [1, 3)
